factions_narrative.name: The Champions of Order
factions_narrative.drive: To impose the perfect, silent order of the goddess Elysia and purge the world of chaotic free will, especially draconic power.
gm_moves: Dispatch an Inquisitor to 'purify' a location.
Declare a local tradition or festival to be heretical.
Offer protection to a community in exchange for absolute obedience.
Reveal that a trusted NPC is a secret informant for the Order.
key_questions: What is the price of perfect safety?
When does order become tyranny?
Can good intentions justify monstrous actions?

factions_narrative.name: Scalebound Clans
factions_narrative.drive: To protect their ancestral lands and the sacred Dragon's Graveyard from outsiders, while wrestling with an internal conflict between preserving the past and weaponizing it.
gm_moves: Close their borders, cutting off a vital mountain pass.
Dispatch a warband to reclaim a 'stolen' artifact.
Challenge a character to a trial of strength to prove their worth.
An elder reveals a forgotten piece of draconic lore.
key_questions: When does tradition become an obstacle?
Is strength defined by aggression or by the will to protect?
What is the burden of a sacred duty?

factions_narrative.name: Arcane Dominion
factions_narrative.drive: To achieve ultimate knowledge and power through magical experimentation, viewing morality, nature, and life itself as acceptable resources to be consumed for progress.
gm_moves: Unleash a magically-mutated beast into the world.
Begin excavating an ancient ruin, corrupting the surrounding area.
Offer a character a tempting shortcut to power at a terrible price.
Capture a unique creature or person for study.
key_questions: What is the cost of unfettered progress?
Where is the line between science and sacrilege?
Are there secrets that humanity was not meant to know?

factions_narrative.name: Ember Concord
factions_narrative.drive: To maintain a fragile peace and prosperity through politics, trade, and diplomacy, while its key members constantly jockey for power and influence.
gm_moves: Impose a trade embargo that affects the party's supplies.
Dispatch a diplomat to offer the party a deal with political strings attached.
Announce a political marriage that will shift the balance of power.
A neutral territory falls under the control of one of the city-states.
key_questions: Can true peace be achieved through compromise?
When does diplomacy become a shield for ambition?
Who gets left behind in the name of political stability?

factions_narrative.name: The Frostfang Packs
factions_narrative.drive: To survive the harsh tundra, honor the spirits of the hunt, and protect their pack from outsiders, especially the encroaching Arcane Dominion.
gm_moves: A hunting party goes missing.
The usurper chieftain, Vargus, uses a piece of Dominion tech to gain an advantage.
An elder shaman offers a cryptic prophecy about the coming winter.
Declare an outsider who has wronged them 'prey'.
key_questions: What is the difference between survival and savagery?
Is loyalty to your leader more important than loyalty to your traditions?
What lines will you cross to protect your own?

factions_narrative.name: The Runeforge Remnants
factions_narrative.drive: To uncover and preserve the lost technologies of the pre-Shattering era, while debating whether that knowledge should be shared or kept hidden.
gm_moves: Activate a long-dormant automated defense system.
Offer to identify a strange artifact in exchange for a dangerous favor.
A radical member attempts to weaponize a newly discovered piece of tech.
Reveal that a common piece of technology is actually a remnant of a more powerful, ancient device.
key_questions: Should the past be preserved or plundered?
Is some knowledge too dangerous to be known?
Who decides how the future is built?

factions_narrative.name: The Astoran Conclave
factions_narrative.drive: To observe the changing tides of the surface world and guard the ancient secrets of the Shattering, intervening only when prophecy dictates.
gm_moves: Deliver a cryptic prophecy or warning.
Reveal the location of a forgotten underwater ruin.
A young acolyte breaks protocol to seek aid from the party.
Seal off their territory as a major event unfolds on the surface.
key_questions: What is the responsibility of those who know the future?
Is it better to preserve history or to live in it?
When does non-interference become complicity?

factions_narrative.name: The Gilded Paw Caravan
factions_narrative.drive: To profit from the conflicts of others by treating information as the most valuable currency, selling secrets to all sides and maintaining a strict neutrality.
gm_moves: Offer to sell crucial information to the party... and their enemies.
Use their network to smuggle a key person or item past a blockade.
An agent reveals they have compromising information about an ally.
Manipulate a local economy for their own gain.
key_questions: Does everyone have a price?
What is the value of a secret?
When does neutrality become a moral failing?

factions_narrative.name: The Brood of Dragnor
factions_narrative.drive: To 'cleanse' the world in fire and chaos in order to usher in a new age of draconic rule, following a fanatical and nihilistic doctrine of destruction.
gm_moves: Attempt to awaken the dormant volcano, Mount Dragnor.
Perform a dark ritual to create a new fire-based monster.
Anoint a new 'Cinder-Clad' champion to lead an attack.
Incite a rebellion or riot under the banner of 'draconic liberation'.
key_questions: Can destruction ever be a creative act?
What is the allure of absolute power?
How is faith twisted into fanaticism?

factions_narrative.name: The Wardens of the Wilds
factions_narrative.drive: To protect the natural and spiritual balance of the world from the corrupting influence of the great nations, acting as guardians of ancient places and creatures.
gm_moves: An ancient creature is stirred to rampage by a faction's actions.
A Warden offers the party a hidden path through dangerous territory.
A sacred grove begins to die, and the Warden demands the party find the cause.
Reveal that a 'monster' the party was hired to kill is actually a guardian.
key_questions: What is the balance between civilization and nature?
Is the wild something to be tamed or revered?
Who speaks for those without a voice?
